p: As noticed before, most of the published data from aerial parts of species belonging to subgenus Perovskia refer to the composition and activities of essential oils, indicating a significant variation [ 67]. A thorough review of the chemical profile of essential oils from subgenus Perovskia is provided by Mohammadhosseini et al. [ 22]. There are very few reports, however, of non-volatile constituents from aerial parts of species belonging to subgenus Perovskia, as a vast majority of them present an analysis of a whole-plant material.
